rev.comment: /* Demographics */ Rmv historical census information, undue on modern demographics
minor addition, the first census after independence
[[Help:Reverting|Reverted]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/Hind meri jaan|Hind meri jaan]] ([[User talk:Hind meri jaan|talk]]) to last version by Fowler&fowler
rv to last by saravask. please take up on talk
/* Modern India */ rm spare comma from "disadvantaged population, remains"—this is my last remaining gripe with the prose as it currently stands

Ankitbhatt, the infobox is rendered at different sizes in different browsers--for me it is very long. Best to leave the first few images left-aligned to prevent them from being shoved down the page. Hyphen for "swift horse" per talk.
/* Medieval India */ -I have put the photo in the right, instead of left, so as to maintain the alternating flow of photos in the article.

Please stop. As Fowler told Ravelnine, such switches must be aired on talk first. I am asked to spend hours/days justifying partial restoration of a copyedit. Likewise, you can't just swap figures without a summary (and no, "updates" doesn't cut it).
/* Modern India */ per regents park's suggestion
/* History */ first restoring the original version and then integrating some of Saravask's edits.
apparently i had the wrong version; Undid revision 458711741 by [[Special:Contributions/Fowler&fowler|Fowler&fowler]] ([[User talk:Fowler&fowler|talk]])
Now restoring Saravask's last edit of today
/* History */ restoring version of 17 August 2011 for purpose of displaying a diff on talk page

When I have time, I will restore those edits I think are OK, but have to revert this for now. Like I said, too many and all at once. Undid revision 458665015 by [[Special:Contributions/Saravask|Saravask]] ([[User talk:Saravask|talk]])

Reinstating non-contested. Fowler, let's be blunt: your castings, like Nikkul's images, usually suck. Many are utterly wrong according to MOS (titles, hyphens, commas, etc). WP has a house style that mostly supercedes often-wrong print outliers.
Again some good edits, some not so; "was now no longer" is commonly used; your replacement is boring;. It think changes like these are best taken up on the talk page

I'm undoing it, only because it is easier for me; Governor-General is commonly capitialized; "small farmer" is commonly used. India doesn't have an activist judiciary; only supreme court; your other edits are good, please reinstate them
:) no its "swift horse" tthe term is commonly used. providing link
/* Medieval India */ "horse cavalry" = arrant pleonasm; other c-e
/* Modern India */ [[MOS:CAPS]]; rm idiosyncratic hyphen/comma; fix weird WWI/ WWII piping/phrasing; use more focused WWI/WWII links; other verbal therapy
Hyphens and serial commas per Noetica's BrEng at Australia. Delink obvious/non-topical/dictionary terms. Will fustigate perpetrators of remaining flubs/pleonasms on talk after Aus travels conclude.
You might be right but take it to the talk page Undid revision 458437588 by [[Special:Contributions/Ravelnine|Ravelnine]] ([[User talk:Ravelnine|talk]])
IMF, UN Data 2011: India 3rd largest economy as per GDP (PPP) and 9th largest as per GDP (nominal); source included from IMF

What is the point of this? It is right-aligned, detailed, and has a long caption that takes up extra lines when wrapped that much. Hardly any vertical space is saved, and there are no sandwiching problems, unlike with other images such as the Tejas.
/* Sport */ replace [[:File:IPL_T20_Chennai_vs_Kolkata.JPG]] with [[:File:Street Cricket Batter India.jpg]] and [[:File:Tribal Street Cricket Orissa India 1.jpg]] per talk

/* Foreign relations and military */ move image up; c-e
/* Economy */ Move BSE up: WB farmer has much higher aspect ratio.
/* Modern India */ I can almost guarantee that 99% of readers know which one is the Mahatma ...
Use [[:File:Nehru_gandhi.jpg]] per discussion on talk. Condense caption.

/* Economy */ Use [[:File:Ploughing with cattle in West Bengal.jpg]] and [[:File:Bombay Stock Exchange 3.jpg]] per several days of discussion and !votes on talk; move RE/power capacity stat to text. Rm non-focused links
/* Foreign relations and military */ [[MOS:ENDASH]] was changed earlier this year—no more spaced en dashes between compounds, even if they're open.
/* Medieval India */ delink page pertaining to European history; only mentions India once

/* Culture */ Replace blown Taj with [[:File:Taj Mahal, Agra, India edit3.jpg]] per discussion on talk. If anyone thinks the discussion needs more time, or that the cropped version is too different from the one proposed, go ahead and revert.
/* Early modern India */ reword for flow

Iamtrhino (or Desijattt or Arinjatt), I am spending hours on talk justifying why my far less wide-ranging image changes should be at least partly reinstated. Tell me why you, a non-regular, are entitled to a free pass. Please raise on talk first.
/* Foreign relations and military */ hide redundant
do not put the 2011 figures (that is just prediction) 2010 are actual figure based on actual GDP growth of India

/* Biodiversity */ Arinjatt, it's best to let browsers choose image sizing. There's no one explicit size that works for all.

Cleanup; it's best to leave image sizing to each user's browser: people are using everything from high-res cinema displays to cell phones. As SpacemanSpiff said, correct option for the few who can't see the details is to click the map.
/* Subdivisions */ increasing map size as space is present anyways
/* Economy */ interim replacement of hacked-looking BSE with cleaner-looking version of same shot; rm filler

Revert Nikkul-trolling. Revert my sole remaining edit to the lead--whatever the hell "here" is supposed to signify. All the consensual malapropisms, transitional fillers, and boring repetitious flab remain untouched. Restore non-controversial edits.
Undid revision 455959379 by [[Special:Contributions/Saravask|Saravask]] ([[User talk:Saravask|talk]]) please discuss image changes. Reverted to original images. Will report if you keep doing this.
rv undiscussed image changes by User;Saravask.
Reverted image changes by User; Saravask. We do NOT replace FEATURED Images without discussion. Please discuss on talk and wait for consensus.

[[WP:JOBTITLES]]; replace turbines with [[:File:Ploughing with cattle in West Bengal.jpg]]; remove [[:File:Bombay Stock Exchange.jpg]]; replace [[:File:Taj Mahal in March 2004.jpg]] with [[:File:GroupFromNorthEastIndiaAtTaj.jpg]]

Rank change from 9th to 10th and other edits by [[User:Tjl1128]] were fastidious and sourced -- Undid revision 455781508 by [[Special:Contributions/Ashok4himself|Ashok4himself]] ([[User talk:Ashok4himself|talk]])

/* Demographics */ Clarify dual-use in caption. This map has more accurate and recent data; old map part of an outdated/broken series. Page never mentioned by name the iconic [[Indian Railways]], world's second largest (and India's largest) employer.
/* Culture */ Moving arts photo to arts section
/* Economy */ rotate two BSE images shot from different angles
/* Government */ Remove image with JPEG [[compression artifact]]s.
/* References */ add one used in rotated caption; fmt

Rv image changes by User;Saravask...Pending discussion on talk. please wait till consensus is achieved to change images. Wiki policy is to discuss changes and get consensus BEFORE making them on main page.
[408]Add: author-link, isbn. Tweak: author-link, doi, isbn. [[WP:UCB|User-activated]].

Rm BO (again): unsuitable bloat in "Politics". Far fewer G-hits for "BhaWan". Replace doctored BSE, blown RB. As cut-and-dried as prose or copyvio clean-up. Another BS revert will be treated as pestiferously [[WP:POINT]]y and time-wasting disruption.
The average global reader doesn't know what Naxalite is. Undid revision 455471820 by [[Special:Contributions/Nikkul|Nikkul]] ([[User talk:Nikkul|talk]])
/* Politics */ fixed spelling of Sansad Bhawan and added more detail of img

Moving back some header changes to FAR. Much environmental information is in the Geography section, megadiverse wildlife is notable. Foreign relations/military, projecting influence/external protection, should be separated from domestic; are mixed
Undid revision 454987470 by [[Special:Contributions/Saravask|Saravask]] ([[User talk:Saravask|talk]]) Please discuss this change on talk before unilaterally making it here. Thanks.
/* Modern India */ fix/link gazetteer title; recast caption; hyphen

/* Medieval India */ Revert to old Tanjore image: high-res replacement's glaring sky/cloud artefacts and crushed blacks are seemingly irresolvable per expert's comment at [[WP:GL/P]]; expand/edit caption.

/* Government */ Replace recently added palace image with serious [[acutance]] issues with a clearer 2,014 × 3,039 version. If any dispassioned long-standing editor who has helped build this article disagrees, we can discuss on talk per [[WP:BRD]].

/* Economy */ Use homologue of paddy/turbine image that has an ordinary farmer. It does not carry ultra-high enc value due (blurriness), but it's the best I could find. Please replace if there's a better/higher-res farm or other representative image.
Fix "rise" -> "rises" in Kedar caption; tweak {{spaces}} padding; move tejas back left, G8 right; use 13-digit ISBNs (delete 10-digit ones), fix dates, NYT/WSJ titles.

/* Geography */ added better pic showing actual mountains
/* Environment */ + shola highland image from KN; again, not saying this is the best or final choice, but for now it goes with the text and seems to have a (misty) mystique about it
/* External links */ + [[Category:Article Feedback Blacklist]]: follow example at [[Canada]] and rm useless piece of dreck gamed by mentally pubescent "ur gay" semi-literates
/* Medieval India */ use somewhat more mysterious-looking (and less flat-lighted or compositionally boring) shot of Brihadeeswarar; recast caption

/* Economy */ why just list 6 countries? Why not list all the developing countries which have higher per capita income than India? Such detailed comparison belongs to [[Economy of India]], not main India article. Anyways, reduced the number to 4.
/* Modern India */ add missing hyphen; fix comma-dash
/* Economy */ U$ -> US$; hyphen; rm slash
Revert lead to honed and non-POV consensus version: discussion is required.
rm indian english note. Is there consensus for this?
rm MediaWiki-inserted newlines; fix regex leftover
Add a note advising use of Indian English; further general cleanup; some upgrade from questionable web/peripheral cites to better book sources.
/* Culture */ link names and switch period/quote; seems it is the painting's title and not a direct quote from somewhere
restore spaces mysteriously removed by spurious edit window
/* Military */ restore spaces removed by browser

Fix last broken cite; light c-e; restore kite: one of only two FPs I know of on WP of an Indian animal actually *in India*, to balance Aussie lotus and Teutonic peacock. Other is a squirrel by [[User:Muhammad Mahdi Karim]] on his user page.
removing Gyan reference, adding citation needed tag
/* Culture */ re-added culture img rotation as per huge discussion in archives.

rm redundant/double spaces; replace dashes; other regex clean-up
/* Cited references */ => "References": they're not all cited (yet); partial tidying.
/* External links */ "autocollapse" not working, so add "|state=collapsed" to {{India topics}}

"Stein 2001" to "Stein 2008"? If wrong, please revert. Also some example {{harvnb}} -> {{sfn}} conversions.
/* Geography */ rm spurious newline--gremlins in my editor again ...
fix harvnbs -- Kulke/Rothermund --> 2002 to 2004; Metcalf/Metcalf; Bose/Jalal+cite book

/* Economy */ Replace unrepresentative and revolting flatulomotive Nano fad with paddy/turbine; not the best such image (a replacement that is better is welcome) but it still bests the fluorescent yellow excrescence that it is replacing.
/* Politics */ Replace boring low-res marginal edifice with Obama parliament interior shot.
/* External links */ prune redundant footers covered by cats/links
/* Cited references */ rm wrong list definition mark-up

/* Biodiversity */ => "Environment"; prune already linked. Use simpler {{sfn}}.
/* Music, dance, theatre and cinema */ => "Arts and cinema"; some c-e; [[WP:DASH]] consistency.

Wording like "here" is iffy/ambiguous for a global readership; merge/reorder sentences thematically based more or less on section order; serial comma; light c-e. Touching the lead is a touchy affair: if any issues, won't mind a rv and chat on talk.
